CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW read as follows :
Article CARDINAL
“ An accused person may be remanded in custody only if there exist specific grounds to believe that he

a ) will abscond in order to evade prosecution or punishment , in particular if his identity can not be immediately established , if he has no permanent residence or if he is under the threat of a heavy punishment ; … . ”
CARDINAL
CARDINAL . Pursuant to LAW , the competent authorities shall give priority to cases involving a person ’s detention on remand and deal with them as speedily as possible .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , an accused person is entitled to request his release at any time . Decisions on such requests are to be taken without delay . In case of dismissal , a request for release may be re - introduced DATE after the relevant decision has become binding if it is based on the same reasons .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL provides that an accused person ’s detention on remand shall not exceed DATE . If it is not possible , because of the complexity of the matter or for other serious reasons , to complete the criminal proceedings within this period , and if the release of the accused person would jeopardise or substantially complicate the achievement of the aim of the proceedings , ORG may extend the detention for the necessary period .

CARDINAL . Under LAW , a person ’s detention on remand shall not exceed DATE . In cases of particularly serious offences , within the meaning of LAW , the maximum period of detention on remand is DATE .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides that the accused person and the victim have the right to request the public prosecutor at any time during the investigation to eliminate delays or any defect in the investigation procedure . The public prosecutor must deal with the request immediately .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL provides for criminal proceedings to be brought before the court in the region where the offence was committed .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL(a ) provides that , after a preliminary hearing , a court should transfer the case to another court if it is not competent to deal with the case itself .
CARDINAL . Under LAW , if the accused person is remanded in custody , the court holding a preliminary hearing must also decide on the person ’s continued detention .
